title: Why should i be punished, because of a client problem?
body:
why should i lose and get demoted, when my internet is perfectly fine? why cant you guys know whether its your client that makes us to not be able to connect or reconnect? why should i be punished for whats not my fault? i would understand if it was my internet but its not.  funny thing is, it doesnt let you reconnect instantly, you have to quit everything. me and caitlyn disconnected, its obviously not our internet, so i dont think thats fair!!

edit1: Thanks im tilted now, and i dont usually tilt!!

replies.body:
This definitely royally sucks >.<

However, from the sounds of it, it looks like your computer wasn't able to connect to the individual game server.  If the game server itself had the issue, then no one would have been able to connect, but it seems like the rest of your team was able to and selected to /remake.  Given you appear to be the only one who experienced this issue, I want to follow-up further:  Is this the only time something like this has happened?  Or do you consistently experience errors getting into and past the Loading Screen?

Let me know!
There was some Isp Maintenance i believe, this should have been informed on the client i think

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/live-incident-breakdown-na/a5Bko4vW-na-backbone-isp-maintenance-ping-increase-and-possible-dcs-in-the-southsouthwest-us.
Funny things is, im not from the US. but 2 of us couldn't connect.

It honestly depends on the maintenance.  There are dozens and dozens of different ISP's all across NA, each doing random maintenance at different times.  If it is significant enough that it affects an entire region,[ then we definitely do message about it](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/live-incident-breakdown-na).  

Otherwise, it is incredibly hard and impractical to constantly message out broadly any time any ISP does maintenance.

Beyond this, where did you see that this ISP maintenance occurred?  Is there a resource you can point me to at all?  I'd be very curious to look into it!
I logged in on Boards, i pointed on the exclamation mark, it said that there were some isp maintenance  for the southern region and ping might increase and dc might occur something like that.
That was on the 17th
the post was made on the 17th yes, but the procedure wasnt only 1 day. if it was, then the post wouldnt have been there all day when disconnected, just saying.

That is actually uniquely my fault.  I was AFK all weekend and didn't set up the proper channels to take that post down.  The post itself clarified it would only be for that day/morning.

Definitely going to make sure that doesn't happen again, but that might explain the issue a bit more >.<
That's fine :P mistakes happens

RIOT why do you always blame the users??????????????????

and cant fix your problems?

Think about it like this:

If there is 3000 miles between you and the Riot server, then there is at least 3000 miles of cable between you and the server.

Riot does not own that cable nor maintain it. 

When there is problems with that cable, the problems are not Riot's.

Honestly the client currently feels really buggy, and it's definitely not just on the user side of things.  I play with a usual group and several of us experience the bug where if you're in a lobby waiting to queue and you click on the hextech crafting icon it will immediately close the client, this happens to us pretty much on a daily basis and we have all tried fresh installs yet it still persists.  

There also seems to be a common issue in champion select where randomly someone's client will freeze and if you try to close the client and rejoin it will immediately dodge the queue and force the wait time before you can queue again.

These are common issues that affect my entire group and while we've grown accustomed to them for the most part, we're used to playing maybe 8-10 games some nights but mostly just normals.  These bugs would be awful for people who were playing ranked and suddenly lose their promotions because of something they can't really control.
